text: Jeraldine Saunders (born Geraldine Loretta Glynn; September 3, 1923 - February 26, 2019) was an American television writer, columnist, model and lecturer. She was born in Los Angeles. Saunders was best known as the creator of The Love Boat, an ABC Television series. She was the columnist of Omarr’s Astrological Forecast, a nationally syndicated horoscope column. Saunders was involved in a homicide investigation in 1968, when she discovered her fiance, actor Albert Dekker dead in his Hollywood home. The death was ruled to be accidental. Saunders died from complications of kidney stone surgery on February 26, 2019 in Los Angeles, aged 95.Jeraldine Saunders Creator and Author of ‘the Love Boat’ Dies at 96 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1923 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:Deaths from kidney disease Category:American television writers Category:American columnists Category:Educators from Los Angeles Category:Models from Los Angeles Category:Writers from Los Angeles
title: Jeraldine Saunders
